member.name: T:DotNetCoreCas.CasAuthenticationTicket
member.summary: Data object representing a Cas Authentication Ticket. The ServiceTicket, stored on the client in the UserData field of a FormsAuthenticationTicket, is used as a key to retrieve the information in this class from a ServiceTicketManager instance. Without a ServiceTicketManager configured, the CasAuthententicationTicket cannot be retrieved.
member.author: Scott Holodak

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasAuthenticationTicket.NetId
member.summary: The NetId username used to authenticate against the CAS server. This information is retrieved via ticket validation and should not from the web application.

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasAuthenticationTicket.ServiceTicket
member.summary: The CAS Service Ticket returned from the CAS Server (typically as the ticket parameter in the URL).

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasAuthenticationTicket.ProxyGrantingTicketIou
member.summary: The Proxy Granting Ticket IOU used to retrieve a Proxy ticket.

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasAuthenticationTicket.ProxyGrantingTicket
member.summary: The Proxy Granting Ticket used to generate Proxy tickets

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasAuthenticationTicket.Proxies
member.summary: The Proxy path associated with the user

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasAuthenticationTicket.OriginatingServiceName
member.summary: The ServiceName used during the initial authentication and ticket validation. When a Single Sign Out request is received from the CAS s server, this is used as a safety mechanism to confirm that the CAS server's SSO request is valid.

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasAuthenticationTicket.ClientHostAddress
member.summary: The IP address of the client that originally requested the CAS Service Ticket. By tracking IP addresses, this enables applications with a ServiceTicketManager configured to detect and/or prevent multiple logins by a user from different IP addresses.

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasAuthenticationTicket.Assertion
member.summary: The CAS assertion associated with the service ticket. This contains the principal name, the validity date/times, and the attributes associated with the service ticket.

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasAuthenticationTicket.ValidFromDate
member.summary: The ValidFromDate associated with the ticket. This is derived from, but not the same as the Assertion's ValidFromDate. If the Assertion's ValidFromDate is equal to DateTime.MinValue, the CasAuthenticationTicket's ValidFromDate is set to DateTime.Now.

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasAuthenticationTicket.ValidUntilDate
member.summary: The ValidUntilDate associated with the ticket. This is derived from, but not the same as the Assertion's ValidUntilDate. If the Assertion's ValidUntilDate is equal to DateTime.MinValue, the following rule is applied: If the Assertion's ValidUntilDate is in the future, the ValidUntilDate is used as is. If the Assertion's ValidUntilDate is in the past, the ValidFromDate + FormsAuthentication.Timeout timespan is used.

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasAuthenticationTicket.Expired
member.summary: Readonly property which indicates whether or not the ValidUntilDate is in the past (i.e., the ticket is expired). Expired tickets should/will be purged from the ServiceTicketManager during the RemoveExpiredTickets() call, during the BeginRequest event handler.

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.CasAuthenticationTicket.#ctor
member.summary: Empty constructor (to be used during Serialization/Deserialization)

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.CasAuthenticationTicket.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,DotNetCoreCas.Security.IAssertion)
member.summary: Public CasAuthenticationTicket constructor
member.param: CAS Service Ticket associated with this CasAuthenticationTicket
ServiceName used during CAS authentication/validation
IP address of the client initiating the authentication request
CAS assertion returned from the CAS server during ticket validation

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.CasAuthenticationTicket.ToString
member.summary: Exposes the CasAuthenticationTicket and all related properties as a multi-line string.
member.returns: A string representation of the CasAuthenticationTicket for use in debugging

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.CasMiddleware.InvokeAsync(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext,Microsoft.Extensions.Options.IOptions{DotNetCoreCas.CasOptions},DotNetCoreCas.Services.ICasAuthService)
member.summary: Hits the CAS server either redirecting to the sign in page or validating a ticket.

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.CasMiddleware.ProcessTicketValidation(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext,DotNetCoreCas.ICasOptions)
member.summary: Processes the ticket from the CAS server to make sure it is valid.

member.name: T:DotNetCoreCas.CASDefaults
member.summary: Default values in CAS Middleware

member.name: F:DotNetCoreCas.CASDefaults.AuthenticationScheme
member.summary: Authentication Scheme for CAS

member.name: T:DotNetCoreCas.TicketValidatorNames
member.summary: Names for the ticket validator to specify the type of server it is using.

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasOptions.CasServerLoginUrl
member.summary: Defines the exact CAS server login URL. e.g. https://cas.princeton.edu/cas/login

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasOptions.CasServerUrlPrefix
member.summary: Defines the prefix for the CAS server. Should be everything up to the URL endpoint, including the /. e.g. http://cas.princeton.edu/

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasOptions.TicketValidatorName
member.summary:
The ticket validator to use to validate tickets returned by the CAS server.
Currently supported values: Cas10 / Cas20 / Saml11 or any fully qualified type which extends AbstractCasProtocolTicketValidator

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasOptions.TicketTimeTolerance
member.summary: Tolerance milliseconds for checking the current time against the SAML Assertion valid times.

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasOptions.Service
member.summary: The Service URL to send to the CAS server. e.g. https://app.princeton.edu/example/

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasOptions.ServerName
member.summary: The server name of the server hosting the client application. Service URL will be dynamically constructed using this value if Service is not specified. e.g. https://app.princeton.edu/

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasOptions.Renew
member.summary: Specifies whether renew=true should be sent to URL's directed to the CAS server.

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasOptions.Gateway
member.summary: Specifies whether or not to redirect to the CAS server logon for a gateway request.

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasOptions.GatewayStatusCookieName
member.summary: The name of the cookie used to store the Gateway status (NotAttempted, Success, Failed). This cookie is used to prevent the client from attempting to gateway authenticate every request.

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasOptions.ArtifactParameterName
member.summary: Specifies the name of the request parameter whose value is the artifact (e.g. "ticket").

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasOptions.ServiceParameterName
member.summary: Specifies the name of the request parameter whose value is the service (e.g. "service")

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasOptions.RequireCasForMissingContentTypes
member.summary: Specifies whether to require CAS for requests that have null/empty content-types

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasOptions.RequireCasForContentTypes
member.summary: Content-types for which CAS authentication will be required

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasOptions.BypassCasForHandlers
member.summary: Handlers for which CAS authentication will be bypassed.

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasOptions.RedirectAfterValidation
member.summary: Whether to redirect to the same URL after ticket validation, but without the ticket in the parameter.

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasOptions.EncodeServiceUrl
member.summary: Whether to encode the session ID into the Service URL.

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasOptions.SingleSignOut
member.summary: Specifies whether single sign out functionality should be enabled.

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasOptions.ServiceTicketManager
member.summary:
The service ticket manager to use to store tickets returned by the CAS server for validation, revocation, and single sign out support.
Currently supported values: A fully qualified type name supporting IServiceTicketManager or the short name of a type in DotNetCasClient.State

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasOptions.ProxyTicketManager
member.summary:
The proxy ticket manager to use to store and resolve ProxyGrantingTicket IOUs to ProxyGrantingTickets
Currently supported values: A fully qualified type name supporting IProxyTicketManager or the short name of a type in DotNetCasClient.State

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasOptions.NotAuthorizedUrl
member.summary: URL to redirect to when the request has a validated and verified CAS Authentication Ticket, but the identity associated with that ticket is not authorized to access the requested resource. If this option is omitted, the request will be redirected to the CAS server for alternate credentials (with the 'renew' argument set).

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasOptions.CookiesRequiredUrl
member.summary: The URL to redirect to when the client is not accepting session cookies. This condition is detected only when gateway is enabled. This will lock the users onto a specific page. Otherwise, every request will cause a silent round-trip to the CAS server, adding a parameter to the URL.

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasOptions.GatewayParameterName
member.summary: The URL parameter to append to outbound CAS request's ServiceName when initiating an automatic CAS Gateway request. This parameter plays a role in detecting whether or not the client has cookies enabled. The default value is 'gatewayResponse' and only needs to be explicitly defined if that URL parameter has a meaning elsewhere in your application. If you choose not define the CookiesRequiredUrl, you can detect that session cookies are not enabled in your application by testing for this parameter in the Request.QueryString having the value 'true'.

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasOptions.ProxyCallbackParameterName
member.summary: The URL parameter to append to outbound CAS proxy request's pgtUrl when initiating an proxy ticket service validation. This is used to determine whether the request is originating from the CAS server and contains a pgtIou.

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasOptions.ProxyCallbackUrl
member.summary: Defines the exact proxy call back url

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasOptions.AuthenticationType
member.summary: Sets the AuthenticationType for IIdentity

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.CasOptions.LocalHost
member.summary: This changes all references to localhost in the url to this current value.

member.name: T:DotNetCoreCas.GatewayStatus
member.summary: Lists the possible states of the gateway feature.
member.author: Scott Holodak

member.name: F:DotNetCoreCas.GatewayStatus.NotAttempted
member.summary: Gateway authentication has not been attempted or the client is not accepting session cookies

member.name: F:DotNetCoreCas.GatewayStatus.Attempting
member.summary: Gateway authentication is in progress

member.name: F:DotNetCoreCas.GatewayStatus.Success
member.summary: The Gateway authentication attempt was successful. Gateway authentication will not be attempted in subsequent requests

member.name: F:DotNetCoreCas.GatewayStatus.Failed
member.summary: The Gateway authentication attempt was attempted, but a service ticket was not returned. Gateway authentication will not be attempted in subsequent requests.

member.name: T:DotNetCoreCas.ICasOptions
member.summary: Added this "unneccessary" interface to allow for CasOptions to be injected through DI into the CasMiddleware.

member.summary: The Assertion backing this Principal

member.summary: The Proxy Granting ticket associated with this principal which is used to generate Proxy tickets to external services.

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.Security.CasPrincipal.Proxies
member.summary: The chain of URL's involved in the proxy authentication of the user on this system. If a user starts on site A, proxy authenticates to site B, and then proxy authenticates to this site, this will contain the URL of site A and site B.

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.Security.CasPrincipal.GetPassword
member.summary: The implementation uses the CAS clearPass extension to obtain the user's password by requesting a proxy ticket for clearPass and parsing out the user's password that is returned as part of the response enclosed within <cas:credentials> elements.

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.Security.CasPrincipal.Identity
member.summary: The IIdentity associated with this IPrincipal

member.summary: Determines whether the user identified by this principal is in the given role by delegating to the default .
member.param: The role to check for membership
member.returns: True if this principal is a member of the given role, false otherwise.

the proxy granting ticket associated with this Principal.

member.author: Scott Battaglia
William G. Thompson, Jr. (.Net)

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.Security.IAssertion.ValidFromDate
member.summary: The date from which this Assertion is valid.

member.summary: The date this Assertion is valid until.

member.summary: The key/value pairs for attributes associated with this Assertion.

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.Security.IAssertion.PrincipalName

member.name: T:DotNetCoreCas.Security.ICasPrincipal
member.summary: Extension to the standard .Net IPrincipal that includes access to the Assertions for the associated user and a way to retrieve Proxy Tickets. for that user.

remarks.para: Developers who don't want their code tied to CAS merely need to work with the .Net IPrincipal. However, in order to take advantabge of CAS specific features like Proxy Tickets and Attributes, ICasPrincipal must be used.

member.author: Scott Battaglia
William G. Thompson, Jr. (.Net)
Scott Holodak (.Net)

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.Security.ICasPrincipal.Assertion
member.summary: The Assertion backing this Principal

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.Security.ICasPrincipal.ProxyGrantingTicket
member.summary: The Proxy Granting ticket associated with this principal which is used to generate Proxy tickets to external services.

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.Security.ICasPrincipal.Proxies
member.summary: The chain of URL's involved in the proxy authentication of the user on this system. If a user starts on site A, proxy authenticates to site B, and then proxy authenticates to this site, this will contain the URL of site A and site B.

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.Security.ICasPrincipal.GetPassword
member.summary: Allows for a mechanism to retrieve the principal's password.

member.name: T:DotNetCoreCas.State.IProxyTicketManager
member.summary: Defines the interface for a ProxyTicketManager implementation. ProxyTicketManagers are responsible for temporary storage of state information relating to Proxy Tickets. For active-active clustered/web-farm configurations, the state must be stored in a persistent storage mechanism that is accessible from any node or server that handles web requests.
member.author: Scott Holodak

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.State.IProxyTicketManager.Initialize
member.summary: You retrieve CasAuthentication properties in the constructor or else you will cause a StackOverflow. CasAuthentication.Initialize() will call Initialize() on all relevant controls when its initialization is complete. In Initialize(), you can retrieve properties from CasAuthentication.

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.State.IProxyTicketManager.RemoveExpiredMappings
member.summary: Removes expired PGTIOU-PGT from the ticket store

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.State.IProxyTicketManager.InsertProxyGrantingTicketMapping(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Method to save the ProxyGrantingTicket to the backing storage facility.
member.param: used as the key
used as the value

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.State.IProxyTicketManager.GetProxyGrantingTicket(System.String)
member.summary: Method to retrieve a ProxyGrantingTicket based on the ProxyGrantingTicketIou. Implementations are not guaranteed to return the same result if retieve is called twice with the same proxyGrantingTicketIou.
member.param: used as the key
member.returns: the ProxyGrantingTicket Id or null if it can't be found

member.name: T:DotNetCoreCas.State.IServiceTicketManager
member.summary: IServiceTicketManager defines the core contract that a ticket manager must implement in order to support the CAS client features which require server-side state tracking.
member.author: Scott Holodak

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.State.IServiceTicketManager.Initialize
member.summary: You retrieve CasAuthentication properties in the constructor or else you will cause a StackOverflow. CasAuthentication.Initialize() will call Initialize() on all relevant controls when its initialization is complete. In Initialize(), you can retrieve properties from CasAuthentication.

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.State.IServiceTicketManager.RemoveExpiredTickets
member.summary: Removes expired entries from the ticket store

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.State.IServiceTicketManager.GetTicket(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve a CasAuthenticationTicket from the ticket store by it's CAS Service Ticket
member.param: The service ticket generated by the CAS server
member.returns: The CasAuthenticationTicket or null if no matching ticket is found

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.State.IServiceTicketManager.InsertTicket(DotNetCoreCas.CasAuthenticationTicket,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Inserts a CasAuthenticationTicket to the ticket store with a corresponding ticket expiration date.
member.param: The CasAuthenticationTicket to insert
The date and time at which the ticket expires

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.State.IServiceTicketManager.UpdateTicketExpiration(DotNetCoreCas.CasAuthenticationTicket,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Updates the expiration date and time for an existing ticket. If the ticket does not exist in the ticket store, just return (do not throw an exception).
member.param: The CasAuthenticationTicket to insert
The new expiration date and time

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.State.IServiceTicketManager.RevokeTicket(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the ticket from the collection if it exists. If the ticket does not exist in the ticket store, just return (do not throw an exception).
member.param: The ticket to remove from the ticket store

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.State.IServiceTicketManager.ContainsTicket(System.String)
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the ticket store contains the supplied serviceTicket
member.param: The service ticket to check for
member.returns: True if the ticket is contained in the store

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.State.IServiceTicketManager.RevokeUserTickets(System.String)
member.summary: Revoke all tickets corresponding to the supplied NetId.
member.param: The NetId to revoke tickets for

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.State.IServiceTicketManager.GetAllTickets
member.summary: Retrieves all tickets in the ticket store that have not already expired.
member.returns: An enumerable collection of CasAuthenticationTickets

member.summary: Retrieves all non-expired tickets in the ticket store associated with the netId supplied.
member.param: The NetId to search the collection for

member.name: T:DotNetCoreCas.Utils.UrlUtil
member.summary: An internal class used to generate and modify URLs as needed for redirection and external communication.
member.remarks: See https://wiki.jasig.org/display/CASC/UrlUtil+Methods for additional information including sample output of each method.
member.author: Scott Holodak

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.Utils.UrlUtil.ConstructLoginRedirectUrl(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext,DotNetCoreCas.ICasOptions)
member.summary: Constructs the URL to use for redirection to the CAS server for login
member.remarks: The server name is not parsed from the request for security reasons, which is why the service and server name configuration parameters exist.
member.returns: The redirection URL to use

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.Utils.UrlUtil.ConstructServiceUrl(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext,DotNetCoreCas.ICasOptions)
member.summary: Constructs a service URL using configured values in the following order: 1. if not empty, the value configured for Service is used - otherwise - 2. the value configured for ServerName is used together with HttpRequest data
member.remarks: The server name is not parsed from the request for security reasons, which is why the service and server name configuration parameters exist, per Apereo website.
member.returns: the service URL to use, not encoded

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.Utils.UrlUtil.ConstructValidateUrl(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection,DotNetCoreCas.ICasOptions)
member.summary: Constructs a URL used to check the validitiy of a service ticket, with or without a proxy callback URL, and with or without requiring renewed credentials.
member.param: The service ticket to validate.
Whether or not renewed credentials are required. If True, ticket validation will fail for Single Sign On credentials.
whether or not to include gatewayResponse=true in the request (client specific).
custom parameters to add to the validation URL
member.returns: The service ticket validation URL to use

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.Utils.UrlUtil.ConstructProxyCallbackUrl(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext,System.Boolean,DotNetCoreCas.ICasOptions)
member.summary: Constructs a proxy callback URL containing a ProxyCallbackParameter (proxyResponse by default). This URL is sent to the CAS server during a proxy ticket request and is then connected to by the CAS server. If the 'CasProxyCallbackUrl' settings is specified, its value will be used to construct the proxy url. Otherwise, `ServerName` will be used. If the CAS server cannot successfully connect (generally due to SSL configuration issues), the CAS server will refuse to send a proxy ticket.
member.returns: the proxy callback URL to use

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.Utils.UrlUtil.ConstructProxyCallbackUrl(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext,DotNetCoreCas.ICasOptions)
member.summary: Constructs a proxy callback URL containing a ProxyCallbackParameter (proxyResponse by default). This URL is sent to the CAS server during a proxy ticket request and is then connected to by the CAS server. If the CAS server cannot successfully connect (generally due to SSL configuration issues), the CAS server will refuse to send a proxy ticket.
member.remarks: This is a .NET implementation specific method used to eliminate the need for a special HTTP Handler. Essentially, if the client detects an incoming request with the ProxyCallbackParameter in the URL (i.e., proxyResponse), that request is treated specially and behaves as if it were handled by an HTTP Handler. In other words, this behavior may or may not short circuit the request event processing and will not allow the underlying page to execute and transmit back to the client. If your application does coincidentally make use of the key 'proxyResponse' as a URL parameter, you will need to configure a custom proxyCallbackParameter value which does not conflict with the URL parameters in your application.
member.returns: the proxy callback URL to use

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.Utils.UrlUtil.ConstructProxyTicketRequestUrl(System.String,System.String,DotNetCoreCas.ICasOptions)
member.summary: Constructs a proxy ticket request URL containing both a proxy granting ticket and a URL Encoded targetServiceUrl. The URL returned will generally only be executed by the CAS client as a part of a proxy redirection in CasAuthentication.ProxyRedirect(...) or CasAuthentication.GetProxyTicketIdFor(...) but may also be used by applications which require low-level access to the proxy ticket request functionality.
member.param: The proxy granting ticket used to authorize the request for a proxy ticket on the CAS server
The target service URL to request a proxy ticket request URL for
member.returns: The URL to use to request a proxy ticket for the targetService specified

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.Utils.UrlUtil.GetProxyRedirectUrl(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext,System.String,DotNetCoreCas.ICasOptions)
member.summary: Attempts to request a proxy ticket for the targetService specified and returns a URL appropriate for redirection to the targetService containing a ticket.
member.param: The target service for proxy authentication
member.returns: The URL of the target service with a proxy ticket included

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.Utils.UrlUtil.ConstructSingleSignOutRedirectUrl(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext,DotNetCoreCas.ICasOptions)
member.summary: Constructs the URL to use for redirection to the CAS server for single signout. The CAS server will invalidate the ticket granting ticket and redirect back to the current page. The web application must then call ClearAuthCookie and revoke the ticket from the ServiceTicketManager to sign the client out.
member.returns: the redirection URL to use, not encoded

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.Utils.UrlUtil.RemoveCasArtifactsFromUrl(System.String,DotNetCoreCas.ICasOptions)
member.summary: Returns a copy of the URL supplied modified to remove CAS protocol-specific URL parameters.
member.param: The URL to remove CAS artifacts from
member.returns: The URL supplied without CAS artifacts

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.Utils.UrlUtil.ResolveUrl(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext,System.String)
member.summary:
Resolves a relative ~/Url to a Url that is meaningful to the client.
Derived from: http://weblogs.asp.net/palermo4/archive/2004/06/18/getting-the-absolute-path-in-asp-net-part-2.aspx
member.author: J. Michael Palermo IV
Scott Holodak
member.param: The Url to resolve
member.returns: The fullly resolved Url

member.name: T:DotNetCoreCas.Validation.CasSaml11Response
member.summary: Represents a CAS SAML 1.1 response from a CAS server, using Xml parsing to populate the object.

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.Validation.CasSaml11Response.HasCasSamlAssertion
member.summary: Whether a valid SAML Assertion was found for processing

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.Validation.CasSaml11Response.CasPrincipal
member.summary: The Apereo CAS ICasPrincipal assertion built from the received CAS SAML 1.1 response

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.Validation.CasSaml11Response.#ctor(System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: Creates a CasSaml11Response from the response returned by the CAS server. The SAMLAssertion processed is the first valid SAML Asssertion found in the server response.
member.param: the xml for the SAML 1.1 response received in response to the samlValidate query to the CAS server
Tolerance milliseconds for checking the current time against the SAML Assertion valid times.

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.Validation.CasSaml11Response.ProcessValidAssertion
member.summary: Initializes the CAS IAssertion for this instance from the first valid Assertion node in the CAS server response.
member.exception: Thrown when data problems are encountered parsing the CAS server response that contains the Assertion, such as no valid Assertion found or no Authentication statment found in the the valid Assertion.

member.name: T:DotNetCoreCas.Validation.SamlUtils
member.summary: Utility methods for processing SAML entities, such as the Assertion in a SAML 1.1 response from a CAS server.

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.Validation.SamlUtils.IsValidAssertion(System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.Int64)
member.summary: Determines whether the SAML Assertion is valid in terms of the 'not before' and the 'not on or after' times.
member.param: the 'not before' time parsed from the Assertion
the 'not on or after' times parsed from the Assertion
Tolerance ticks for checking the current time against the SAML Assertion valid times.
member.returns: true if this Assertion is valid relative to the current time; otherwise returns false

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.Validation.SamlUtils.GetAttributesFor(System.Xml.XmlNode,System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager,System.String)
member.summary: Populates an IDictionary with the Attributes from the SAML Assertion for the given SAML Subject.
member.param: the Attribute statement parsed from the SAML Assertion
the XmlNamespaceManager for the input XMLNode containing the SAML Attribute statement to be parsed
the SAML Subject for which Attributes are to be retrieved
member.returns: the IDictionary of matching attributes, which will be an empty IDictionary if no matches are found. The key is the Attribute name and the value is the IList of values for that Attribute, which might be an empty IList.
member.exception: Thrown if expected entries if the requested SAML subject can not be parsed from the attrStmtNode.

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.Validation.SamlUtils.GetAttributeValue(System.Xml.XmlAttributeCollection,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the value for the specified attribute name from the collection of attributes.
member.param: the attributes to process
the name of the attribute desired
member.returns: the parsed value if the attribute is found; otherwise null is returned.

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.Validation.SamlUtils.GetAttributeValueAsDateTime(System.Xml.XmlNode,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the value for the specified attribute name and converts it to a DateTime value.
member.param: the node containing the attributes to be processed
the name of the attribute desired
member.returns: the parsed and converted value
member.exception: Thrown if the desired attribute is not found

member.summary:
The endpoint of the validation URL. Should be relative (i.e. not start with a "/"). i.e. validate or serviceValidate.
CAS 1.0: validate
CAS 2.0: serviceValidate or proxyValidate
SAML 1.1: samlValidate

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.Validation.TicketValidator.Cas20ServiceTicketValidator.ParseResponseFromServer(System.String,System.String,DotNetCoreCas.ICasOptions)
member.summary:
Parses the response from the server into a CAS Assertion and includes this in a CASPrincipal.
Parsing of a <cas:attributes> element is not supported. The official CAS 2.0 protocol does include this feature. If attributes are needed, SAML must be used.
member.param: the response from the server, in any format.
The ticket used to generate the validation response
member.returns: a Principal backed by a CAS Assertion, if one could be created from the response.
member.exception: Thrown if creation of the Assertion fails.

member.name: T:DotNetCoreCas.Validation.TicketValidator.ITicketValidator
member.summary: Contract for a validator that will confirm the validity of a supplied ticket.

remarks.para: Validator makes no statement about how to validate the ticket or the format of the ticket (other than that it must be a String).

member.author: Scott Battaglia
William G. Thompson, Jr. (.Net)
Scott Holodak (.Net)

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.Validation.TicketValidator.ITicketValidator.ArtifactParameterName
member.summary: The name of the request parameter whose value is the artifact for the cas protocol. The default values are defined in DefaultArtifactParameterName, but these can be overridden in web.config.

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.Validation.TicketValidator.ITicketValidator.ServiceParameterName
member.summary: The default name of the request parameter whose value is the service for the protocol. The default values are defined in DefaultServiceParameterName, but these can be overridden in web.config.

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.Validation.TicketValidator.ITicketValidator.UrlSuffix
member.summary:
The endpoint of the validation URL. Should be relative (i.e. not start with a "/"). i.e. validate or serviceValidate.
CAS 1.0: validate
CAS 2.0: serviceValidate or proxyValidate
SAML 1.1: samlValidate

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.Validation.TicketValidator.ITicketValidator.Initialize(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext,DotNetCoreCas.ICasOptions)
member.summary: You retrieve CasAuthentication properties in the constructor or else you will cause a StackOverflow. CasAuthentication.Initialize() will call Initialize() on all relevant controls when its initialization is complete. In Initialize(), you can retrieve properties from CasAuthentication.

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.Validation.TicketValidator.ITicketValidator.Validate(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext,System.String,DotNetCoreCas.ICasOptions)
member.summary: Attempts to validate a ticket for the provided service.
member.param: the ticket to validate
member.returns: The ICasPrincipal backed by the CAS Assertion included in the response from the CAS server for a successful ticket validation.

member.name: T:DotNetCoreCas.Validation.TicketValidator.Saml11TicketValidator
member.summary: SAML 1.1 Ticket Validator
member.author: Scott Battaglia
Catherine D. Winfrey (.Net)
Marvin S. Addison
Scott Holodak (.Net)

member.name: P:DotNetCoreCas.Validation.TicketValidator.Saml11TicketValidator.UrlSuffix
member.summary: The endpoint of the validation URL. Should be relative (i.e. not start with a "/"). i.e. validate or serviceValidate or samlValidate.

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.Validation.TicketValidator.Saml11TicketValidator.Initialize(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext,DotNetCoreCas.ICasOptions)
member.summary: Performs Saml11TicketValidator initialization.

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.Validation.TicketValidator.Saml11TicketValidator.ParseResponseFromServer(System.String,System.String,DotNetCoreCas.ICasOptions)
member.summary: Parses the response from the server into a CAS Assertion and includes this in a CASPrincipal.
member.param: the response from the server, in any format.
The ticket used to generate the validation response
member.returns: a Principal backed by a CAS Assertion, if one could be created from the response.
member.exception: Thrown if creation of the Assertion fails.

member.name: M:DotNetCoreCas.Validation.TicketValidator.Saml11TicketValidator.RetrieveResponseFromServer(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Requests CAS ticket validation by the configured CAS server.
member.param: the URL to use for ticket validation
the ticket returned by the CAS server from a successful authentication
member.returns: the XML response representing the ticket validation
